articles.description: Washington quarterback Taylor Heinicke is back.Heinicke has been cleared to return from COVID-19, according to Nicki Jhabvala of the Washington Post.That means Heinicke will be good to go on Sunday night, when Washington plays at Dallas.Heinicke was part of a…
articles.content:
Washington quarterback Taylor Heinicke is back.
Heinicke has been cleared to return from COVID-19, according to Nicki Jhabvala of the Washington Post.
That means Heinicke will be good to go on Sund… [+499 chars]

articles.title: Illinois blitzes Mizzou in Tigers' second-most lopsided Braggin' Rights loss - STLtoday.com
articles.description: Tigers had no answer for Illini threes and Kofi Cockburn
articles.content: Three Illinois guards (Grandison, Frazier and Plummer) made three threes a piece, and none of those three attempted more than seven. Attempting to fight fire with fire was not an option for Mizzou. T… [+1185 chars]

articles.author: Dave Matter
articles.title: Army's last-second field goal spoils Brady Cook's heroics in Mizzou heart-breaking bowl loss - STLtoday.com
articles.description: Cook drives Tigers to go-ahead TD in final minutes, but Army’s 41-yarder as time expires is the difference in 24-22 victory.
articles.content:
The Mizzou Tigers lost against Army on the last play of the Armed Forces Bowl. Coach Eli Drinkwitz and players Brady Cook, Blaze Alldredge and Harrison Mevis gave post-game interviews.
